<small>Aramaic form: [[H3848]]</small>
 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבֵשׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבַשׁ‎</span> **verb** ==put on== (a garment), ==wear, clothe, be clothed== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לָבֵישׁ‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***labâšu***</u></abbr>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); — 

**Qal** Perfect 3 masculine singular<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבֵשׁ‎</span> [[Ps.93.1|Ps 93:1]] (twice in verse), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבַשׁ‎</span> [[Job.7.5|Job 7:5]] + 2 t., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלָבַשׁ‎</span> (consecutive) [[Lev.6.3|Lev 6:3]] + 3 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּלְבָשֵׁם‎</span> (consecutive) [[Lev.16.4|Lev 16:4]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָֽבְשָׁה‎</span> [[Judg.6.34|Judg 6:34]] + 2 t., etc. ([[Ezek.42.14|Ezek 42:14]] read probably<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלָֽבְשׁוּ‎</span> [[BDB#Qr|Qr]], for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ילבשׁו‎</span> [[BDB#Kt|Kt]], but clause perhaps interpolated, see [[BDB#Co|Co]]); ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלְבַּשׁ‎</span> [[Deut.22.5|Deut 22:5]] +; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּלְבָּשֵׁנִי‎</span> [[Job.29.14|Job 29:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלְבָּשָׁם‎</span> [[Exod.29.30|Exod 29:30]] 1 singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלְבָּשֶׁ֑נָּה‎</span> [[Song.5.3|Song 5:3]] 3 feminine plural<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּלְבַּשְׁןָ‎</span> [[2Sam.13.18|2Sam 13:18]], etc.; ***Imperative*** masculine singular<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבַשׁ‎</span> [[1Kgs.22.30|1Kgs 22:30]], etc.;***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבוֺשׁ‎</span> [[Hag.1.6|Hag 1:6]] ***construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִלְבּשׁ‎</span> [[Gen.28.20|Gen 28:20]]; [[Lev.21.10|Lev 21:10]] ***Participle active*** plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַלֹּבְשִׁים‎</span> [[Zeph.1.8|Zeph 1:8]] ***passive*** absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבוּשׁ‎</span> [[1Sam.17.5|1Sam 17:5]]; [[Dan.10.5|Dan 10:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבֻשׁ‎</span> [[Ezek.9.2|Ezek 9:2]] + 3 t.; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבוּשׁ‎</span> [[Dan.12.6|Dan 12:6]]; [[Dan.12.7|Dan 12:7]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבֻשׁ‎</span> [[Ezek.9.11|Ezek 9:11]] + 3 t.; plural construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבֻשֵׁי‎</span> [[Ezek.23.6|Ezek 23:6]] + 2 t.; — 

**1. a.** literally *** put on *** (one's own) garment (accusative) [[Gen.38.19|Gen 38:19]]; [[1Sam.28.8|1Sam 28:8]]; [[2Sam.14.2|2Sam 14:2]]; [[1Kgs.22.30|1Kgs 22:30]] = [[2Chr.18.29|2Chr 18:29]]; [[Exod.29.30|Exod 29:30]]; [[Lev.6.3|Lev 6:3]]; [[Lev.6.4|Lev 6:4]]; [[Lev.16.4|Lev 16:4]] (twice in verse); [[Lev.16.23|Lev 16:23]]; [[Lev.16.24|Lev 16:24]]; [[Lev.16.32|Lev 16:32]]; [[Lev.21.10|Lev 21:10]]; [[Deut.22.5|Deut 22:5]]; [[Ezek.44.17|Ezek 44:17]]; [[Ezek.44.19|Ezek 44:19]], and so [[Ezek.42.14|Ezek 42:14]] [[BDB#Qr|Qr]] (see above), [[Jonah.3.5|Jonah 3:5]]; [[Song.5.3|Song 5:3]]; [[Esth.4.1|Esth 4:1]]; [[Esth.5.1|Esth 5:1]] with accusative garment + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלבְּֿשָׂרוֺ‎</span> [[Lev.16.3|Lev 16:3]] of putting on armour [[Jer.46.4|Jer 46:4]] = ***wear*** (more or less habitually), with accusative of garment, [[Isa.4.1|Isa 4:1]]; [[Deut.22.11|Deut 22:11]]; [[Zeph.1.8|Zeph 1:8]]; [[Zech.13.4|Zech 13:4]] of Jerusalem under figure of woman [[Jer.4.30|Jer 4:30]], of rulers under figure of shepherds [[Ezek.34.3|Ezek 34:3]], compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֵּן תִּלְבַּשְׁןָ‎</span> [[2Sam.13.18|2Sam 13:18]] (no accusative) 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** very often figurative, ***put on, be clothed with***, with accusative of garment; — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבַשׁ בְּשָׂרִי רִמָּה‎</span> [[Job.7.5|Job 7:5]] ***my flesh is clothed*** (i.e. covered) ***with worms***; of Jerusalem, ***be clothed with*** inhabitants [[Isa.49.18|Isa 49:18]] of pasture, with flocks [[Ps.65.14|Ps 65:14]] more often the garment is some abstract quality, e.g. righteousness, majesty, beauty, strength, etc.; — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּלְבַּשׁ צְדָקָה כַּשִּׁרְיָן‎</span> [[Isa.59.17|Isa 59:17]] he (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>) ***hath put on righteousness as a breastplate***, compare v[[Isa.59.17|Isa 59:17]] (vengeance), [[Ps.93.1|Ps 93:1]] (majesty), v[[Ps.93.1|Ps 93:1]] (strength), [[Ps.104.1|Ps 104:1]] (honour and majesty), [[Isa.51.9|Isa 51:9]] (strength); also [[Job.40.10|Job 40:10]] said of men, [[2Chr.6.41|2Chr 6:41]] (salvation), [[Ps.132.9|Ps 132:9]] (righteousness), [[Job.29.14|Job 29:14]] (***id.***); of Zion [[Isa.52.1|Isa 52:1]] (twice in verse); also in bad sense, clothed with terror, trembling, shame, etc., [[Ezek.7.27|Ezek 7:27]]; [[Ezek.26.16|Ezek 26:16]]; [[Job.8.22|Job 8:22]]; [[Ps.35.26|Ps 35:26]]; [[Ps.109.29|Ps 109:29]], compare v[[Ps.35.18|Ps 35:18]] (cursing). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** literally ***put on***, object omitted, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָתַןבֶּ֗֗֗גֶד לִלְבּשׁ‎</span> [[Gen.28.20|Gen 28:20]]; [[Job.27.17|Job 27:17]] ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָבוֺשׁ‎</span> [[Hag.1.6|Hag 1:6]] (there is) ***a clothing***, but he has nothing for warmth. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** once with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבוּשׁאֲ֗֗֗שֶׁר לָבַשׁ בּוֺ‎</span> [[Esth.6.8|Esth 6:8]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** ***Passive participle, clothed with***, chiefly Ezek.; — with accusative of garment, [[Ezek.9.2|Ezek 9:2]]; [[Ezek.9.3|Ezek 9:3]]; [[Zech.3.3|Zech 3:3]]; [[Prov.31.21|Prov 31:21]]; [[Dan.10.5|Dan 10:5]] of wearing armour [[1Sam.17.5|1Sam 17:5]] construct before garment, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבֻשׁ הַבַּדִּים‎</span> [[Ezek.9.11|Ezek 9:11]]; [[Ezek.10.2|Ezek 10:2]]; [[Ezek.10.6|Ezek 10:6]]; [[Ezek.10.7|Ezek 10:7]], compare [[Ezek.23.6|Ezek 23:6]]; [[Ezek.23.12|Ezek 23:12]]; [[Ezek.38.4|Ezek 38:4]]; [[Dan.12.6|Dan 12:6]]; [[Dan.12.7|Dan 12:7]]. **feminine** ==figurative:== — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָֽבְשָׁה אֶתגִּֿדְע֑וֺן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְרוּחַ י‎</span> [[Judg.6.34|Judg 6:34]] ***and the spirit of*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> ***clothed itself with Gideon***, i.e. ([[BDB#GFM|GFM]]) took possession of him (compare <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***possessed***); so [[1Chr.12.18|1Chr 12:18]]; [[2Chr.24.20|2Chr 24:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צֶדֶק לָבַשְׁתִּי וַיִּלְבָּשֵׁנִי‎</span> [[Job.29.14|Job 29:14]] and it ***clothed itself*** in me, as it were, became incarnate in me. **Pu\`al** only ***Participle*** plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְלֻבָּשִׁים‎</span> ***arrayed***, with accusative of garment [[1Kgs.22.10|1Kgs 22:10]] = [[2Chr.18.9|2Chr 18:9]]; [[2Chr.5.12|2Chr 5:12]] absolute ***in full apparel*** [[Ezra.3.10|Ezra 3:10]]. **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִלְבִּישַׁנִי‎</span> [[Isa.61.10|Isa 61:10]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִלְבִּישָׁה‎</span> [[Gen.27.16|Gen 27:16]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֫‎</span> [[Exod.28.41|Exod 28:41]] + 3 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּם‎</span> (consecutive) [[Exod.29.8|Exod 29:8]]; [[Num.20.26|Num 20:26]] 1 singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִלְבַּשְׁתִּיו‎</span> [[Isa.22.21|Isa 22:21]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִלְבִּישׁוּ‎</span> [[2Chr.28.15|2Chr 28:15]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִלְבִּשׁוּ‎</span> (consecutive) [[Esth.6.9|Esth 6:9]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּלְבֵּשׁ‎</span> [[Gen.41.42|Gen 41:42]] + 5 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּלְבִּשֵׁם‎</span> [[Gen.3.21|Gen 3:21]]; [[Lev.8.13|Lev 8:13]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּלְבִּישׁ‎</span> [[Prov.23.21|Prov 23:21]], etc.; ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַלְבֵּשׁ‎</span> [[Zech.3.4|Zech 3:4]] construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַלְבִּישׁ‎</span> [[Esth.4.4|Esth 4:4]] ***Participle*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמַּלְבִּשְׁכֶם‎</span> [[1Sam.1.24|1Sam 1:24]] — ***clothe, array with***. 

**1.** usually with 2 accusative, 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** literal <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיּלְבֵּשׁ אֹתוֺ בִּגְדֵישֵֿׁשׁ‎</span> [[Gen.41.42|Gen 41:42]]; [[2Sam.1.24|2Sam 1:24]]; [[Isa.22.21|Isa 22:21]]; [[Exod.28.41|Exod 28:41]]; [[Exod.29.5|Exod 29:5]]; [[Exod.29.8|Exod 29:8]]; [[Exod.40.13|Exod 40:13]]; [[Exod.40.14|Exod 40:14]]; [[Lev.8.7|Lev 8:7]]; [[Lev.8.13|Lev 8:13]]; [[Num.20.26|Num 20:26]]; [[Num.20.28|Num 20:28]]; [[Zech.3.4|Zech 3:4]]; [[Zech.3.5|Zech 3:5]] of clothing Jerusalem under figure of infant [[Ezek.16.10|Ezek 16:10]] of putting armour on some one [[1Sam.17.38|1Sam 17:38]] (twice in verse). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** figurative, [[Job.10.11|Job 10:11]] ***thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh***; compare [[Job.39.19|Job 39:19]] (quivering of horse's neck); [[Isa.50.3|Isa 50:3]]; [[Isa.61.10|Isa 61:10]]; [[Ps.132.16|Ps 132:16]]; [[Ps.132.18|Ps 132:18]]. 

**2.** with accusative garment only, [[Gen.27.16|Gen 27:16]] ( + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַליָֿדָיו‎</span>); figurative, [[Prov.23.21|Prov 23:21]]. 

**3.** with accusative of person only, [[Gen.3.21|Gen 3:21]]; [[Gen.27.15|Gen 27:15]]; [[2Chr.28.15|2Chr 28:15]] (twice in verse); [[Esth.4.4|Esth 4:4]]; [[Esth.6.9|Esth 6:9]]; [[Esth.6.11|Esth 6:11]].
